result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricky Lee Bryant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

The Court GRANTS request. 
The fine, costs and surcharges shall be paid on or before: April 30, 2018
Special terms: $518 to be paid as a rate of $25/month effective 7/1/16.

Letter from defendant requesting a payment plan.
Corrected JOC

Defendant Ricky Lee Bryant in court with attorney Thomas J Erickson.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Juanita B.

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 45 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 5 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. STAYED to 7/11/2014 by noon.
-Defendant is to pay court costs and victim/witness surcharges by 7/1/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 7/1/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
-Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
-Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Justice Point report received and filed. sab

Defendant Ricky Lee Bryant in court with attorney Thomas J Erickson.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense request plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Ricky Lee Bryant in court with attorney Thomas J Erickson.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Filed, State's Motion In Limine.
Filed, State's Requested Jury Instructions.
Filed, State's Witness List.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection received and filed.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/30/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ricky Lee Bryant in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Ricky Lee Bryant in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
